titleStmt.title: The faithful squire: or, The fortunate farmer's daughter: had she conserted to his will, when he rid first that way, she might have been unmarried still, though now a lady gay. To the tune of, Charon. This may be printed, R.P.

The faithful squire: or, The fortunate farmer's daughter: had she conserted to his will, when he rid first that way, she might have been unmarried still, though now a lady gay. To the tune of, Charon. This may be printed, R.P.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the Angel in Giltspur-street,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "There was I'll tell you a wealthy young squire,".
Place of publication from Wing, which estimates publication date 1685-1688.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
